intro: Erucastrum incanum, commonly known as the pale erucoid, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many cruciferous plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, grayish stems and small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine pubescence. Erucastrum incanum is typically found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
